website_summaries.verdict: An easy-to-swallow vitamin A supplement that is also affordable.
pros: Each dose contains 8,000 IU of vitamin A from retinyl palmitate
Some users reported better vision after just one week
cons: Contains soybean oil and fish liver oil, so not ideal for vegetarians or those sensitive to soy

customer_reviews.title: Please replace the soybean oil with a healthier version like coconut or olive oil
customer_reviews.text: I can't seem to find a vitamin A (in oil capsules) that does not have soybean oil in it. Soybean oil is considered toxic (it oxidizes easily and it is very estrogenic). While I realize it could be cost effective for the manufacturers, it's not healthy for the consumers. Many of us wouldn't mind paying a little bit more for a healthier version of the vitamin.
customer_reviews.author: n

customer_reviews.title: Helped My Vision
customer_reviews.text: I love these! At one point I was having problems with my eyes. They would go in and out of focus even when I had my glasses on. These vitamins were recommended and within a week my eyes were much better!
customer_reviews.author: Maryam

customer_reviews.title: Lung  Fortifier
customer_reviews.text: My pulmonologist recommended Vitamin A for my lungs and I am improving !

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver. I need a vitamin A supplement to help ...

customer_reviews.title: Vitamin A for an edge on illnesses.

customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Not sure of any true benefits from taking these yet, but I have had no negative side effects.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle P

customer_reviews.title: Works, but overpriced on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing for adult acne sufferers. I've tried every antibiotic out there. I was even on Metformin. Nothing helped. In my last attempt to heal my skin before resorting to Accutane, I tried Vit A instead. Now I am NOT a medical professional but I knew overdoses of Vit A can be dangerous when taken unsupervised by a physician. So even this 8000IU I took it with caution. Starting off with one capsule every other day before taking ONE daily. For me, it has helped tremendously. No new breakouts (I used to get at least 3-4 daily) and no side effects so far. Also, you can get this same bottle for cheaper elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: veevee

customer_reviews.title: Got rid of my Cat allergies!
customer_reviews.text: Took these a few times a week, drastically helped my allergies. So thankful a pharmacist recommended I try these, they work!

customer_reviews.title: Must have vitamin!
customer_reviews.text: It has improved my acne scars along with other vitamins :)

customer_reviews.author: Dong Ug Kim

customer_reviews.title: Nature Made Vitamin A, 8000IU, Softgels, 100ct.
customer_reviews.text: I have used nature made products before and I like the amount of soft gels for the price. The soft gels are small and easy to swallow. As for the benefits, without blood tests, it is difficult to tell, but I have found that when I stop taking these supplements, my joints are achy and stiff. I take this along with Vitamin E, Fish oil and other supplements for my arthritis. I would recommend them to anyone who has stiff joints but would also warn them, if you are taking a vitamin supplement regularly, you should skip taking these soft gels to avoid possible vitamin A toxcidity.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Horse

customer_reviews.title: vitamin A
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs vitamin A, and this brand seems to be as good as any on the market. I'll continue to order it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: reliable oil-based vitamin A
customer_reviews.text: This product arrives promptly, and is fresh. If you do not like to take beta carotene for your vitamin A, this could be the right choice for you.
customer_reviews.author: ibex

customer_reviews.title: Took these at a doctors request
customer_reviews.text: I had a doctors appointment and he told me to take these to gain a little more energy if I feel tired. I have to say taking in conjunction with vitamin D, while taking them I did have more energy and felt less tired. Not to the point that that I didn't need sleep, but i didn't have the urge to take naps and was feeling well rested when waking up in the morning when getting 6-8 hours of sleep. Amazon had, as usual, the cheapest price around.

I don't know how or why I ordered Swanson Vitamin A also but I am happy with Swanson but did want to comment Nature Made in General.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: 8,000 units is a safe dose to take daily since I already get some vitamin A from Carlson’s lemon flavored cod liver oil. (More than 10,000 units per day is toxic to the liver). What I’m finding so amazing is how it’s actually improving my vision, which I know to be true because I no longer need my reading glasses for tiny print. I looked this one up and found vitamin A slows macular degeneration. This product would be perfect if it didn’t have soy which is why it gets 4 stars.

customer_reviews.title: Love it for great skin
customer_reviews.text: I started taking these not really knowing what to expect, and I'm really happy with the results. My skin is much smoother and more even. My pores seem smaller but I can't say my skin is less oily, which I'm hoping for.

customer_reviews.title: using topically per Derm instructions
customer_reviews.text: My Derm suggested I use these liquid softgels to help treat a couple of stubborn warts on my fingers, we've been doing the liquid nitrogen freezings as well. I haven't been doing this very long so I haven't seen any results yet but these softgels are way cheaper that buying a dropper of vitamin A so I just poke little holes in them and apply to my fingers several times a day. 1 soft gel lasts me about 3 days.

customer_reviews.title: Nature Made products are always "fresh."
customer_reviews.text: I always purchase Nature Made vitamins. Their products are always "fresh", especially their iron pills. How do you know if a vitamin or pill is fresh? Place the pill in water and see how long it takes to dissolve. This is how long it will take to dissolve in your body. Nature Made's products doesn't take long to dissolve, therefore I suggest to my daughters and friends to look for this brand. They agree.

customer_reviews.text: i chose this 5 star rating because these are very hard to buy in stores. i recommend buying these tablets only on amazon, choose wisely with the venders on this website. i emailed the vender that was selling this product to me, and i had to make sure that it was coming on time to my house, and they said they would let me know when it would come, and it came almost late to my house. some venders are not trust worthy sometimes, so choose wisely. the vender is called otc master. there not a bad vender, so be careful, when buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: christa wiswesser

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons:  Be aware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have allergic dry eyes and I also wear contact lenses. I don't always eat a balanced diet and thought this might help. 8,000 IU is towards the upper recommended level of 10,000 IU for daily consumption. Vitamin A (retinol) is fat stored and therefore excess is not excreted daily. I also experienced some mild side effects - acid reflux and dizziness. I may try to take a capsule every other day, but I would prefer a lower dose.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Good vitamin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take to help with acne, I have not been taking it everyday so I am not sure what it can do but it is easy to take and a good price.
